metadata.title: CVE-2021-4203 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free read flaw was found in sock_getsockopt() innet/core/sock.c due to SO_PEERCRED and SO_PEERGROUPS race with listen()(and connect()) in the Linux kernel. In this flaw, an attacker with a userprivileges may crash the system or leak internal kernel information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-17-generic - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-5.15.0-17-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-generic - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-generic-64k - 5.15.0-17.17
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-17-lowlatency - 5.15.0-17.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-1007-kvm - 5.13.0-1007.7+22.04.1
No subscription required
